trans-unit.source: Print from your app
trans-unit.target: Print from your app

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.Graphics.Printing
trans-unit.target: Windows.Graphics.Printing

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Xaml.Printing
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Xaml.Printing

trans-unit.source: PrintDocument
trans-unit.target: PrintDocument

trans-unit.source: Learn how to print documents from a Universal Windows app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to print documents from a Universal Windows app.

trans-unit.source: This topic also shows how to print specific pages.
trans-unit.target: This topic also shows how to print specific pages.

trans-unit.source: For more advanced changes to the print preview UI, see [Customize the print preview UI](customize-the-print-preview-ui.md).
trans-unit.target: For more advanced changes to the print preview UI, see [Customize the print preview UI](customize-the-print-preview-ui.md).

trans-unit.source: **Tip** Most of the examples in this topic are based on the print sample.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** Most of the examples in this topic are based on the print sample.

trans-unit.source: To see the full code, download the [Universal Windows Platform (UWP) print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984) from the [Windows-universal-samples repo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619979) on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: To see the full code, download the [Universal Windows Platform (UWP) print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984) from the [Windows-universal-samples repo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619979) on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Register for printing
trans-unit.target: Register for printing

trans-unit.source: The first step to add printing to your app is to register for the Print contract.
trans-unit.target: The first step to add printing to your app is to register for the Print contract.

trans-unit.source: Your app must do this on every screen from which you want your customer to be able to print.
trans-unit.target: Your app must do this on every screen from which you want your customer to be able to print.

trans-unit.source: Only the screen that is displayed to the user can be registered for printing.
trans-unit.target: Only the screen that is displayed to the user can be registered for printing.

trans-unit.source: If one screen of your app has registered for printing, it must unregister for printing when it exits.
trans-unit.target: If one screen of your app has registered for printing, it must unregister for printing when it exits.

trans-unit.source: If it is replaced by another screen, the next screen must register for a new Print contract when it opens.
trans-unit.target: If it is replaced by another screen, the next screen must register for a new Print contract when it opens.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** If you need to support printing from more than one page in your app, you can put this print code in a common helper class and have your app pages reuse it.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** If you need to support printing from more than one page in your app, you can put this print code in a common helper class and have your app pages reuse it.

trans-unit.source: For an example of how to do this, see the `PrintHelper` class in the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984).
trans-unit.target: For an example of how to do this, see the `PrintHelper` class in the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984).

trans-unit.source: First, declare the [**PrintManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226426) and [**PrintDocument**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR243314).
trans-unit.target: First, declare the [**PrintManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226426) and [**PrintDocument**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR243314).

trans-unit.source: The **PrintManager** type is in the [**Windows.Graphics.Printing**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226489) namespace along with types to support other Windows printing functionality.
trans-unit.target: The **PrintManager** type is in the [**Windows.Graphics.Printing**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226489) namespace along with types to support other Windows printing functionality.

trans-unit.source: The **PrintDocument** type is in the [**Windows.UI.Xaml.Printing**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR243325) namespace along with other types that support preparing XAML content for printing.
trans-unit.target: The **PrintDocument** type is in the [**Windows.UI.Xaml.Printing**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR243325) namespace along with other types that support preparing XAML content for printing.

trans-unit.source: You can make it easier to write your printing code by adding the following **using** or **Imports** statements to your page.
trans-unit.target: You can make it easier to write your printing code by adding the following **using** or **Imports** statements to your page.

trans-unit.source: The [**PrintDocument**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR243314) class is used to handle much of the interaction between the app and the [**PrintManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226426), but it exposes several callbacks of its own.
trans-unit.target: The [**PrintDocument**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR243314) class is used to handle much of the interaction between the app and the [**PrintManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226426), but it exposes several callbacks of its own.

trans-unit.source: During registration, create instances of **PrintManager** and **PrintDocument** and register handlers for their printing events.
trans-unit.target: During registration, create instances of **PrintManager** and **PrintDocument** and register handlers for their printing events.

trans-unit.source: In the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984), registration is performed by the `RegisterForPrinting` method.
trans-unit.target: In the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984), registration is performed by the `RegisterForPrinting` method.

trans-unit.source: When the user goes to a page that supports, it initiates the registration within the `OnNavigatedTo` method.
trans-unit.target: When the user goes to a page that supports, it initiates the registration within the `OnNavigatedTo` method.

trans-unit.source: When the user leaves the page, disconnect the printing event handlers.
trans-unit.target: When the user leaves the page, disconnect the printing event handlers.

trans-unit.source: If you have a multiple-page app and don't disconnect printing, an exception is thrown when the user leaves the page and then comes back to it.
trans-unit.target: If you have a multiple-page app and don't disconnect printing, an exception is thrown when the user leaves the page and then comes back to it.

trans-unit.source: Create a print button
trans-unit.target: Create a print button

trans-unit.source: Add a print button to your app's screen where you'd like it to appear.
trans-unit.target: Add a print button to your app's screen where you'd like it to appear.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that it doesn't interfere with the content that you want to print.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that it doesn't interfere with the content that you want to print.

trans-unit.source: Next, add an event handler to your app's code to handle the click event.
trans-unit.target: Next, add an event handler to your app's code to handle the click event.

trans-unit.source: Use the [**ShowPrintUIAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.graphics.printing.printmanager.showprintuiasync) method to start printing from your app.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**ShowPrintUIAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.graphics.printing.printmanager.showprintuiasync) method to start printing from your app.

trans-unit.source: **ShowPrintUIAsync** is an asynchronous method that displays the appropriate printing window.
trans-unit.target: **ShowPrintUIAsync** is an asynchronous method that displays the appropriate printing window.

trans-unit.source: If printing can't be performed at that time, the method will throw an exception.
trans-unit.target: If printing can't be performed at that time, the method will throw an exception.

trans-unit.source: We recommend catching these exceptions and letting the user know when printing can't proceed, as shown here.
trans-unit.target: We recommend catching these exceptions and letting the user know when printing can't proceed, as shown here.

trans-unit.source: In this example, a print window is displayed in the event handler for a button click.
trans-unit.target: In this example, a print window is displayed in the event handler for a button click.

trans-unit.source: If the method throws an exception (because printing can't be performed at that time), a [**ContentDialog**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn633972) control informs the user of the situation.
trans-unit.target: If the method throws an exception (because printing can't be performed at that time), a [**ContentDialog**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn633972) control informs the user of the situation.

trans-unit.source: Format your app's content
trans-unit.target: Format your app's content

trans-unit.source: When **ShowPrintUIAsync** is called, the [**PrintTaskRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206597) event is raised.
trans-unit.target: When **ShowPrintUIAsync** is called, the [**PrintTaskRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206597) event is raised.

trans-unit.source: The **PrintTaskRequested** event handler shown in this step creates a [**PrintTask**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226436) by calling the [**PrintTaskRequest.CreatePrintTask**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226436request_createprinttask) method and passes the title for the print page and the name of a [**PrintTaskSourceRequestedHandler**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.graphics.printing.printtask.source) delegate.
trans-unit.target: The **PrintTaskRequested** event handler shown in this step creates a [**PrintTask**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226436) by calling the [**PrintTaskRequest.CreatePrintTask**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226436request_createprinttask) method and passes the title for the print page and the name of a [**PrintTaskSourceRequestedHandler**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.graphics.printing.printtask.source) delegate.

trans-unit.source: Notice that in this example, the **PrintTaskSourceRequestedHandler** is defined inline.
trans-unit.target: Notice that in this example, the **PrintTaskSourceRequestedHandler** is defined inline.

trans-unit.source: The **PrintTaskSourceRequestedHandler** provides the formatted content for printing and is described later.
trans-unit.target: The **PrintTaskSourceRequestedHandler** provides the formatted content for printing and is described later.

trans-unit.source: In this example, a completion handler is also defined to catch errors.
trans-unit.target: In this example, a completion handler is also defined to catch errors.

trans-unit.source: It's a good idea to handle completion events because then your app can let the user know if an error occurred and provide possible solutions.
trans-unit.target: It's a good idea to handle completion events because then your app can let the user know if an error occurred and provide possible solutions.

trans-unit.source: Likewise, your app could use the completion event to indicate subsequent steps for the user to take after the print job is successful.
trans-unit.target: Likewise, your app could use the completion event to indicate subsequent steps for the user to take after the print job is successful.

trans-unit.source: After the print task is created, the [**PrintManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226426) requests a collection of print pages to show in the print preview UI by raising the [**Paginate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.printing.printdocument.paginate) event.
trans-unit.target: After the print task is created, the [**PrintManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226426) requests a collection of print pages to show in the print preview UI by raising the [**Paginate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.printing.printdocument.paginate) event.

trans-unit.source: This corresponds with the **Paginate** method of the **IPrintPreviewPageCollection** interface.
trans-unit.target: This corresponds with the **Paginate** method of the **IPrintPreviewPageCollection** interface.

trans-unit.source: The event handler you created during registration will be called at this time.
trans-unit.target: The event handler you created during registration will be called at this time.

trans-unit.source: **Important** If the user changes print settings, the paginate event handler will be called again to allow you to reflow the content.
trans-unit.target: **Important** If the user changes print settings, the paginate event handler will be called again to allow you to reflow the content.

trans-unit.source: For the best user experience, we recommend checking the settings before you reflow the content and avoid reinitializing the paginated content when it's not necessary.
trans-unit.target: For the best user experience, we recommend checking the settings before you reflow the content and avoid reinitializing the paginated content when it's not necessary.

trans-unit.source: In the [**Paginate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.printing.printdocument.paginate) event handler (the `CreatePrintPreviewPages` method in the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984)), create the pages to show in the print preview UI and to send to the printer.
trans-unit.target: In the [**Paginate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.printing.printdocument.paginate) event handler (the `CreatePrintPreviewPages` method in the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984)), create the pages to show in the print preview UI and to send to the printer.

trans-unit.source: The code you use to prepare your app's content for printing is specific to your app and the content you print.
trans-unit.target: The code you use to prepare your app's content for printing is specific to your app and the content you print.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984) source code to see how it formats its content for printing.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984) source code to see how it formats its content for printing.

trans-unit.source: When a particular page is to be shown in the print preview window, the [**PrintManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226426) raises the [**GetPreviewPage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.printing.printdocument.getpreviewpage) event.
trans-unit.target: When a particular page is to be shown in the print preview window, the [**PrintManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226426) raises the [**GetPreviewPage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.printing.printdocument.getpreviewpage) event.

trans-unit.source: This corresponds with the **MakePage** method of the **IPrintPreviewPageCollection** interface.
trans-unit.target: This corresponds with the **MakePage** method of the **IPrintPreviewPageCollection** interface.

trans-unit.source: The event handler you created during registration will be called at this time.
trans-unit.target: The event handler you created during registration will be called at this time.

trans-unit.source: In the [**GetPreviewPage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.printing.printdocument.getpreviewpage) event handler (the `GetPrintPreviewPage` method in the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984)), set the appropriate page on the print document.
trans-unit.target: In the [**GetPreviewPage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.printing.printdocument.getpreviewpage) event handler (the `GetPrintPreviewPage` method in the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984)), set the appropriate page on the print document.

trans-unit.source: Finally, once the user clicks the print button, the [**PrintManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226426) requests the final collection of pages to send to the printer by calling the **MakeDocument** method of the **IDocumentPageSource** interface.
trans-unit.target: Finally, once the user clicks the print button, the [**PrintManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR226426) requests the final collection of pages to send to the printer by calling the **MakeDocument** method of the **IDocumentPageSource** interface.

trans-unit.source: In XAML, this raises the [**AddPages**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.printing.printdocument.addpages) event.
trans-unit.target: In XAML, this raises the [**AddPages**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.printing.printdocument.addpages) event.

trans-unit.source: The event handler you created during registration will be called at this time.
trans-unit.target: The event handler you created during registration will be called at this time.

trans-unit.source: In the [**AddPages**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.printing.printdocument.addpages) event handler (the `AddPrintPages` method in the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984)), add pages from the page collection to the [**PrintDocument**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR243314) object to be sent to the printer.
trans-unit.target: In the [**AddPages**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.printing.printdocument.addpages) event handler (the `AddPrintPages` method in the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984)), add pages from the page collection to the [**PrintDocument**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR243314) object to be sent to the printer.

trans-unit.source: If a user specifies particular pages or a range of pages to print, you use that information here to add only the pages that will actually be sent to the printer.
trans-unit.target: If a user specifies particular pages or a range of pages to print, you use that information here to add only the pages that will actually be sent to the printer.

trans-unit.source: Prepare print options
trans-unit.target: Prepare print options

trans-unit.source: Next prepare print options.
trans-unit.target: Next prepare print options.

trans-unit.source: As an example, this section will describe how to set the page range option to allow printing of specific pages.
trans-unit.target: As an example, this section will describe how to set the page range option to allow printing of specific pages.

trans-unit.source: For more advanced options, see [Customize the print preview UI](customize-the-print-preview-ui.md).
trans-unit.target: For more advanced options, see [Customize the print preview UI](customize-the-print-preview-ui.md).

trans-unit.source: This step creates a new print option, defines a list of values that the option supports, and then adds the option to the print preview UI.
trans-unit.target: This step creates a new print option, defines a list of values that the option supports, and then adds the option to the print preview UI.

trans-unit.source: The page range option has these settings:
trans-unit.target: The page range option has these settings:

trans-unit.source: Option name
trans-unit.target: Option name

trans-unit.source: Action
trans-unit.target: Action

trans-unit.source: Print all
trans-unit.target: Print all

trans-unit.source: Print all pages in the document.
trans-unit.target: Print all pages in the document.

trans-unit.source: Print Selection
trans-unit.target: Print Selection

trans-unit.source: Print only the content the user selected.
trans-unit.target: Print only the content the user selected.

trans-unit.source: Print Range
trans-unit.target: Print Range

trans-unit.source: Display an edit control into which the user can enter the pages to print.
trans-unit.target: Display an edit control into which the user can enter the pages to print.

trans-unit.source: First, modify the [**PrintTaskRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206597) event handler to add the code to get a [**PrintTaskOptionDetails**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh701256) object.
trans-unit.target: First, modify the [**PrintTaskRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206597) event handler to add the code to get a [**PrintTaskOptionDetails**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh701256) object.

trans-unit.source: Clear the list of options that are shown in the print preview UI and add the options that you want to display when the user wants to print from the app.
trans-unit.target: Clear the list of options that are shown in the print preview UI and add the options that you want to display when the user wants to print from the app.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The options appear in the print preview UI in the same order they are appended, with the first option shown at the top of the window.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The options appear in the print preview UI in the same order they are appended, with the first option shown at the top of the window.

trans-unit.source: Create the new print option and initialize the list of option values.
trans-unit.target: Create the new print option and initialize the list of option values.

trans-unit.source: Add your custom print option and assign the event handler.
trans-unit.target: Add your custom print option and assign the event handler.

trans-unit.source: The custom option is appended last so that it appears at the bottom of the list of options.
trans-unit.target: The custom option is appended last so that it appears at the bottom of the list of options.

trans-unit.source: But you can put it anywhere in the list, custom print options don't need to be added last.
trans-unit.target: But you can put it anywhere in the list, custom print options don't need to be added last.

trans-unit.source: The [**CreateTextOption**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.graphics.printing.optiondetails.printtaskoptiondetails.createtextoption) method creates the **Range** text box.
trans-unit.target: The [**CreateTextOption**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.graphics.printing.optiondetails.printtaskoptiondetails.createtextoption) method creates the **Range** text box.

trans-unit.source: This is where the user enters the specific pages they want to print when they select the **Print Range** option.
trans-unit.target: This is where the user enters the specific pages they want to print when they select the **Print Range** option.

trans-unit.source: Handle print option changes
trans-unit.target: Handle print option changes

trans-unit.source: The **OptionChanged** event handler does two things.
trans-unit.target: The **OptionChanged** event handler does two things.

trans-unit.source: First, it shows and hides the text edit field for the page range depending on the page range option that the user selected.
trans-unit.target: First, it shows and hides the text edit field for the page range depending on the page range option that the user selected.

trans-unit.source: Second, it tests the text entered into the page range text box to make sure that it represents a valid page range for the document.
trans-unit.target: Second, it tests the text entered into the page range text box to make sure that it represents a valid page range for the document.

trans-unit.source: This example shows how the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984) handles change events.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984) handles change events.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** See the `GetPagesInRange` method in the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984) for details on how to parse the page range the user enters in the Range text box.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** See the `GetPagesInRange` method in the [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984) for details on how to parse the page range the user enters in the Range text box.

trans-unit.source: Preview selected pages
trans-unit.target: Preview selected pages

trans-unit.source: How you format your app's content for printing depends on the nature of your app and its content.
trans-unit.target: How you format your app's content for printing depends on the nature of your app and its content.

trans-unit.source: The [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984) uses a print helper class to format its content for printing.
trans-unit.target: The [UWP print sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619984) uses a print helper class to format its content for printing.

trans-unit.source: When printing a subset of the pages, there are several ways to show the content in the print preview.
trans-unit.target: When printing a subset of the pages, there are several ways to show the content in the print preview.

trans-unit.source: Regardless of the method you chose to show the page range in the print preview, the printed output must contain only the selected pages.
trans-unit.target: Regardless of the method you chose to show the page range in the print preview, the printed output must contain only the selected pages.

trans-unit.source: Show all the pages in the print preview whether a page range is specified or not, leaving the user to know which pages will actually be printed.
trans-unit.target: Show all the pages in the print preview whether a page range is specified or not, leaving the user to know which pages will actually be printed.

trans-unit.source: Show only the pages selected by the user's page range in the print preview, updating the display whenever the user changes the page range.
trans-unit.target: Show only the pages selected by the user's page range in the print preview, updating the display whenever the user changes the page range.

trans-unit.source: Show all the pages in print preview, but grey out the pages that are not in page range selected by the user.
trans-unit.target: Show all the pages in print preview, but grey out the pages that are not in page range selected by the user.

trans-unit.source: Related topics
trans-unit.target: Related topics

trans-unit.source: Design guidelines for printing
trans-unit.target: Design guidelines for printing

trans-unit.source: //Build 2015 video: Developing apps that print in Windows 10
trans-unit.target: //Build 2015 video: Developing apps that print in Windows 10

trans-unit.source: UWP print sample
trans-unit.target: UWP print sample
